_exec_summary.SummaryText:
North Texas Municipal Water District
Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant
RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment. The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment. The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel and local emergency response agencies will respond to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.

2.0 Description of The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant and Regulated Substances

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant handles two substances regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity. These substances are:

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water.
* Chlorine - stored in 150 pound cylinder and used for the disinfection of water for off-site facilities within  
   the North Texas Municipal Water District System.
* Sulfur dioxide - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for dechlorination of water.

3.0 Hazard Assessment

The RMP Rule requires The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant to perform a Hazard Assessment of the regulated substances stored and used in the covered processes at

the facility. This Hazard Assessment includes an offsite consequence analysis for the following scenarios:

* One worst-case and one alternative release scenario for each of the toxic substances sulfur dioxide and chlorine used in the disinfection and dechlorination of effluent at the facility. In addition, one worst-case and one alternative release scenario for the toxic substance chlorine stored in 150 pound cylinder and used off-site for the disinfection of wastewater.  The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant completed a Hazard Assessment for the covered processes and the results have been appropriately communicated to the local emergency response agencies. The Hazard Assessment has been recently updated to reflect changes in population.

4.0 Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The RMP Rule requires that a prevention program be established for The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant disinfection process. The following details the prevention program elements at The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant that apply to these processes.

4.1 Safety Information

The North Texas Municipal Water District Water Treatment Plant maintains a variety of technical documents that are used to help ensure safe operation of The North Texas Municipal Water District Water Treatment Plant processes. Material safety data sheets (MSDSs) document the physical and chemical properties of hazardous substances handled at The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant, including chlorine and sulfur dioxide used in the covered process. The engineering design documents include the operating parameters, the design basis and configuration of the equipment in each covered process, and references to applicable codes and standards. 
	
4.2 Hazard Review

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant performs and periodically updates hazard reviews of the covered processes to help identify and control process hazards. Checklists are used to guide the hazard review. These checklists include items to help ensure The North Texas Municipal Water District Water Treatment Plant operates and maintains the equipment in a manner consistent with the applicable design specifications, codes, standards, and regulations.

4.3 Operating Procedures

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant develops and maintains operating procedures to define how tasks related to process operations should be performed. The operating procedures are used to:

1. train employees and contractors, and
2. serve as reference guides for appropriate actions to take during both normal and abnormal process conditions.

4.4 Training

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. A record of all training is maintained to help ensure new and refresher training is provided on a timely basis.

4.5 Maintenance 

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant properly maintains the equipment in our processes. The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant maintenance program includes:

1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks,
2. worker training in the maintenance procedures, and
3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.

4.6 Compliance Audits

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to ver

ify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP Rule. A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.

4.7 Incident Investigations

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment. The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation. An investigation team is assembled and the investigation is initiated within 48 hours of the incident. The results of the investigation are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.

4.8 Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Process chemicals

Industry standards are followed at The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant to help ensure safe handling of process chemicals. The vendor supplies chlorine and sulfur dioxide via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton and 150 pound cylinders. The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes. Workers who perform operations involving chlorine and sulfur dioxide receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant.

5.0 Five Year Accident History
There has been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatme

nt Plant in the past five years.

6.0 Emergency Response Programs

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant has prepared a written emergency action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines. This plan has been communicated to the Collin County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and local fire department.

7.0 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant continuously attempts to improve the safety of our processes to protect our employees, the public and the environment. The North Texas Municipal Water District Rowlett Creek Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant incident investigations, employee suggestions and improvements in technology are utilized to update the safety aspects of the processes.
